name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Food & fuel prices have skyrocketed & the U.S. & other countries are aggressively raising interest rates. The IMF warned that we are headed for “stormy waters.” A world-wide recession looks likely. Developing countries are bracing for disaster & need a new SDR issuance now.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: I introduced the Robust International Response to COVID Act after the pandemic started b/c an SDR issuance was needed to help countries fund health care, infrastructure, food access, & more. Since then, new challenges have emerged, and a new issuance is critical.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: SDRs are a reserve asset that cost American taxpayers $0. The last issuance was a huge success. It provided economic relief to countries, allowing them to purchase vaccines, tests, & other essentials—w/ Sub-Saharan Africa benefiting the most https://t.co/ndBZWU8uys

🧵on SDRs

We should use the Clean Water Act to:

-Emphasize public health, by reducing water pollution and ensuring clean water for drinking and recreation to low-income communities

-Mitigate the effects of climate change and reduce wetlands loss.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: As people in my district know very well, clean drinking water is still not a guarantee in Latino, Black, and Indiginous communities. Congress must reassert its oversight and continue to push for enforcement. https://t.co/7zIhZ8HM5b

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: A cleanup project has been negotiated, and it’s critical for nearby communities that we see that project through.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: 🧵Bubbly Creek comes to mind, which was a dumping ground for Chicago’s meatpacking industry. Though it’s cleaner now, the river still bubbles—and has been polluted by heavy metals, raw sewage, and an oil spill. https://t.co/IHfOPmQReT

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Their legal protection under the Clean Water Act has been affirmed and reaffirmed by the courts for decades. If the Supreme Court reaffirms this attack on the Clean Water Act, 50% of all wetlands and 70% of streams would no longer be federally protected.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Wetlands naturally prevent excess flooding during catastrophic weather events and trap and filter pollutants that would otherwise be carried into downstream waters.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Sackett v. EPA is a Supreme Court case that could change how the government decides which waterways and wetlands are protected by the Clean Water Act. https://t.co/uboLisY64i

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: The Clean Water Act funded the clean-up of many iconic waterways, including the Chicago River, which runs through the district I represent. The River is now the cleanest it’s been in 150 years, and cleaner water helps protect communities like mine that live and play near it. https://t.co/MDJ6P4T9ym

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: It’s time we stop allowing corporate executives to make millions by buying back their own stock and demand big corporations invest in their workers and equipment instead.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: The Reward Work Act repeals a Regan-era SEC rule that legalized stock buybacks in ‘82. Before that, stock buybacks were rightfully considered market manipulation. The bill also empowers workers by requiring that public companies allow workers to directly elect 1/3 of their boards

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Stock buybacks worsen the racial wealth gap. Latino & Black households own <1% of the total stock market value while white households own 90%. White households benefit disproportionately when megacorporations buy back their stock & inflate its price https://t.co/o5Ms1xqxGc

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: @IPS_DC found that a majority of low-wage firms spent billions on stock buybacks while cutting worker pay. Like @Lowes. It used its profits to spend $13 billion in 2021 on stock buybacks while median worker pay dropped by 7.6% https://t.co/5MHq4spLvg

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: @AbbottNews used profits to buy back its stock instead of replacing faulty equipment that experts believe caused dangerous bacteria to seep into infant nutritional products, killing 9 babies, poisoning more, and causing an ongoing formula shortage https://t.co/RWww0gApyv

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Megacorporations use stock buybacks to inflate the price of their own stock and pay out executives and investors, instead of using profits to pay workers a fair wage and make necessary improvements to their products. The consequences can be deadly.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text:
🚨Reintroducing the Reward Work Act today with @RepPeterDeFazio @RepRoKhanna & 11 others to rein in stock buybacks that pad the pockets of executives & shareholders at the expense of workers & our economy.

🧵on their harm, how our bill fixes the problem & increases worker power

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: However, the Inflation Reduction Act represents a historic investment in health and climate priorities that will benefit working class families like the ones I represent. I applaud the bill’s passage and look forward to President Biden signing it into law.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: To be clear, this bill does not do enough, alone, to address the climate crisis. Nor does it tackle many of the other key issues I have pushed for in previous reconciliation packages, like immigration reform, affordable housing, and universal childcare.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: This package does the most we’ve ever done to create green jobs and make green energy affordable. It also lowers prescription drug prices, caps the price of insulin for Medicare recipients, and more than pays for itself by making billionaires pay their fair share of taxes.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: After months advocating for a progressive reconciliation bill, we are delivering a package of common sense policies to help families in my district and across the country.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: 🧵I voted for the Inflation Reduction Act because investments to lower prescription drug and energy costs, extend health care for millions, and combat climate change cannot wait.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: We must confront our moral and political responsibility to end over 500 years of colonialism in Puerto Rico, but we must do so with the direct input from those who would be most impacted.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: we must recognize that the decision and input should come from those who will be impacted most: the Puerto Rican people.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: the status of Puerto Rico in the Olympic games, and the future of the island’s debt and tax policies. While many may disagree about the future of Puerto Rico’s status,

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: their perspectives into the debate – this bill did not receive one. Additionally, the bill lacks clarity and specificity on key issues for my constituents and their loved ones on the island including how U.S. citizenship would be defined under Sovereignty in Free Association,

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text:
but it must be done in an inclusive, thoughtful, and transparent manner.

Puerto Ricans deserve a formal and accessible legislative hearing on a bill of such importance wherein members of the Puerto Rican community and interested stakeholders have an opportunity to contribute

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: the future for generations of Puerto Ricans living on the island and across the diaspora. We have an opportunity to rectify Puerto Rico’s long-standing colonial status, which has resulted in its people being treated as second-class citizens –

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: As a Member representing one of the largest and most vibrant Puerto Rican communities in the country, I do not take this decision lightly. The outcome from today’s committee markup, and eventually, votes in the full House of Representatives and the U.S. Senate will determine

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Puerto Rico’s relationship with the U.S. is rooted in a history of racism, exploitation, and oppression. The time is now for the process of decolonization and self-determination on the island.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: The colonization of Puerto Rico is a shameful part of our country’s history. From the moment the U.S. took control of the island, to a century of limited citizenship, the imposition of PROMESA, and our failures in disaster response,

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: While today marks an important first step in the decolonization process of Puerto Rico, I could not in good faith support the passage of  H.R. 8393, Puerto Rico Status Act in its current form.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: 🧵 This afternoon, I voted against H.R. 8393, the Puerto Rico Status Act in today’s @NRDems Resources markup.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: También insto a mis colegas en la Cámara y el Senado a tomar más medidas, como una prohibición de armas de asalto y verificaciones universales de antecedentes, que puedan ayudar a mantener las armas de guerra alejadas de nuestros niños y nuestras comunidades.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Este proyecto de ley es un paso atrasado, pero va en la dirección correcta, y espero que el Presidente Biden lo convierta en ley lo antes posible.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Además, debemos estar atentos a que los mecanismos de aplicación de este proyecto de ley no se utilicen para criminalizar aún más a las comunidades latinas y afroamericanas que estén plagadas desproporcionadamente de violencia armada.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: y muchas de las disposiciones del proyecto de ley dependen en gran medida de la aplicación estatal, que falta en muchos lugares.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Desafortunadamente, estas medidas no van lo suficientemente lejos. Las verificaciones de antecedentes más exhaustivas solo habrían evitado una pequeña fracción de los trágicos tiroteos que nuestro país ha enfrentado recientemente,

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: También invierte en servicios cruciales, como salud mental en las escuelas, clínicas comunitarias que proporcionan servicios de salud del comportamiento y apoyo después de eventos traumáticos.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: mantener las armas alejadas de personas que hayan sido condenadas por abuso y violencia doméstica y promueve nuevas leyes estatales que limitan el acceso a las armas de fuego.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Esta legislación toma medidas importantes para sacar las armas peligrosas de nuestras calles al mejorar las verificaciones de antecedentes para las personas menores de 21 años,

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Tras innumerables muertes innecesarias y décadas de inacción frustrante, la Ley Bipartidista de Comunidades más Seguras trae algunos cambios necesarios a nuestras leyes sobre armas de fuego.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Mi distrito, al igual que otras comunidades de clase trabajadora e inmigrantes en todo el país, es uno de los muchos que ha sufrido profundamente por la tragedia de la violencia armada.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: 🧵 Mi votó hoy por la aprobación de la Ley Bipartidista de Comunidades más Seguras, un paquete de prevención de la violencia armada que ayudará a mantener las armas mortales fuera de las manos de personas peligrosas e invertirá en seguridad escolar y salud mental.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: I also urge my colleagues in the House and Senate to take up further measures, like an assault weapons ban and universal background checks, that can help keep weapons of war away from our children and our communities.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: This bill is an overdue step in the right direction, and I hope President Biden signs it into law as soon as possible.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Additionally, we must be vigilant that the enforcement mechanisms of this bill are not used to further criminalize Latino and Black communities disproportionately plagued by gun violence.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Enhanced background checks would have only prevented a small fraction of the tragic shootings our country has faced recently, and many of the bill’s provisions rely heavily on state enforcement—which is lacking in many places.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Unfortunately these measures do not go nearly far enough.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: It also invests in crucial services such as school-based mental health, community behavioral health clinics, and support after traumatic events.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: This legislation takes important steps toward getting dangerous guns off our streets by enhancing background checks for people under 21, keeping guns away from convicted domestic abusers, and promoting new state laws that limit access to firearms.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: After countless unnecessary deaths and decades of frustrating inaction, the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act brings some necessary changes to our gun laws.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: My district, like other working class and immigrant communities across the country, is one of many that has suffered deeply from tragic gun violence.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: 🧵Today I voted to pass the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, a gun violence prevention package that will help keep deadly weapons away from dangerous individuals and invest in school safety and mental health.

name: Congressman Chuy García

name: Congressman Chuy García

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Decriminalizing cannabis confronts racism at the center of our nation’s drug policy, gives individuals a second chance, and creates an opportunity for our communities to thrive.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: The MORE Act establishes small business assistance, which will be essential to promoting racial and economic equity as the industry grows.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: While Latino and Black communities are targeted by the war on drugs, they are also severely underrepresented in ownership and operation of cannabis businesses. In Illinois, out of 226 dispensaries registered statewide, only 17 are owned by non-white individuals.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: The bill also removes marijuana from the Controlled Substances Act.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: The MORE Act helps undo damage inflicted by the failed, racist war on drugs. It makes previously jailed individuals eligible for educational, financial, and employment opportunities currently unavailable to them by clearing low-level marijuana offenses from their record.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: In recent reporting from Chicago, Latino and Black individuals still accounted for 95% of marijuana-related arrests.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: The implications of this hundred-year scare campaign are profound— marijuana policies have disproportionately incarcerated generations of Latino and Black individuals, tearing families apart and derailing lives and careers for minor offenses.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Since the first anti-marijuana laws & throughout the war on drugs, marijuana policy has been constructed according to racist & anti-immigrant biases. Even the drug’s name ‘marijuana’, was popularized amid efforts to negatively associate the cannabis plant with Mexican immigrants.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text:
Today, I voted for the #MOREAct to decriminalize cannabis and expunge federal cannabis-related convictions. This legislation is a much needed step toward restorative justice and away from over-policing our communities.

🧵Thread below👇🏾

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Surcharge reform enjoys international support: Last year the IMF’s G-24 group of countries recommended that the Fund suspend, reform, or eliminate surcharges.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Argentina will pay more than three billion dollars to the IMF in surcharge fees between 2018 and 2023– enough to vaccinate every Argentine nine times against COVID-19.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Ukraine owes tens of millions of dollars to the IMF in these surcharge fees each month, and it will have paid half a billion dollars in surcharges by the end of next year.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: The IMF imposes “surcharge fees” to countries that hold large loans or owe for a long time. These charges are above and beyond regular loan and interest payments.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: Today along with @RepJayapal I am introducing the Stop Onerous Surcharges (S.O.S.) Act, which would direct the @USTreasury to support a review of the IMF's surcharge policy and a pause on surcharges for the duration of the review. This would help @Ukraine at a time of great need.

tweet_text: I am proud of the work we have done to pass this historic legislation, & pleased to see it signed into law. I look forward to passing the #BuildBackBetter Act so we can send it to Senate to pass, and then on to @POTUS desk. Today is a good day, but there is still work to be done.

name: Congressman Chuy García
tweet_text: It means expanding and modernizing public transportation like @CTA, Pace Buses, and @Metra. It also means billions of dollars to ensure clean drinking water and clean air by removing lead pipes from our communities and working to reduce our reliance on fossil fuels.
